items.content_html:
Summary

this is a data-* property, using data might be a little conflict

so using the same format as html.global_attributes.data_attributes

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Update description of svg.global_attributes.data_attributes

items.content_html:
Summary

the data is taken from SVGElement.autofocus, as they both share the same test

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add svg.global_attributes.autofocus

items.content_html:
Summary

it has been adding back to specification via w3c/ServiceWorker#1729

see https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#dom-installevent-installevent

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add spec_url for `InstallEvent` constructor

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the className member of the SVGElement API. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.12.4).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/SVGElement/className

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the contentEditable.plaintext-only member of the HTMLElement API. The data comes from manual testing, running test code through BrowserStack, SauceLabs, custom VMs and/or locally.

Test Code:


document.body.contentEditable = 'plaintext-only'; console.log(document.body.contentEditable == 'plaintext-only');
items.title: Update Safari data for api.HTMLElement.contentEditable.plaintext-only

items.content_html:
Summary

It's "supported" in that it is recognized by the browser but there is no code in the file chooser interface on mobile phones to allow selection of a directory when using it.

Test results and supporting details

I tried using this option on a phone and there was no way to choose a folder to upload.
https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=271705
https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40248532
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1887878

Related issues

Fixes #24357
items.title: Add note about lack of proper support for webkitdirectory on mobile
